workflow.name: Automate external attack surface mapping with Shodan API and DNS lookups
workflow.description:
The **Bug Bounty Target Recon** n8n workflow is a powerful automation tool for security professionals and ethical hackers.

It efficiently automates the time-consuming process of external attack surface mapping.

By taking a domain, the workflow performs DNS Lookups to identify all associated IP addresses, and then utilizes the Shodan API to query:

- Detailed service banners
- Open ports
- Technologies
- Known vulnerabilities

This system delivers crucial, organized OSINT data, saving the user hours of manual scripting and reconnaissance, and providing a clear, actionable map of a target's exposed infrastructure.

nodes.name: START ‚Äì Set target domain
nodes.notes:
Blue
Workflow entry point.
Set the domain you want to recon.

parameters.content:
## Set Target Domain
**Set the domain you want to recon.**
Be sure to set the value to https:\\**your_ target_website_here.com** and leave the name as *target_domain*

nodes.name: DNS lookup (Google)
nodes.notes:
Green
Pull all DNS records for the domain (A, AAAA, CNAME, ‚Ä¶).

parameters.content:
## DNS Lookup
**Pull all DNS records for the domain (A, AAAA, CNAME, ‚Ä¶)**

nodes.name: Filter only IP records
nodes.notes:
Yellow
Keep only A and AAAA records ‚Äì we only need IPs for Shodan.

parameters.content:
## Filter Only IP Records 
**Keep only A and AAAA records ‚Äì we only need IPs for Shodan.**

nodes.name: Rate-limit before Shodan
nodes.notes:
Orange
10 s pause ‚Äì respects Shodan free-tier limits.

parameters.content:
## Delay (rate-limit)
**10 s pause ‚Äì respects Shodan free-tier limits.**

nodes.name: Parse Shodan JSON
nodes.notes:
Red
Flattens banners/ports into one row per service.
Handles errors, empty responses, and diagnostics.

parameters.content:
## Parse Shodan Data
**Flattens banners/ports into one row per service.**

nodes.name: Write results
nodes.notes:
Purple
Append every row to Google Sheet.
Also prints to console for quick checks.

parameters.content:
## Google Sheets
**Append every row to Google Sheet.**

nodes.name: Error catcher
nodes.notes:
Gray
Any node that throws goes here (No-Op placeholder).

parameters.content:
## Error Handler
**Any node that throws an error goes here (No-Op placeholder).**

## Bug Bounty Target Recon
**This n8n workflow performs automated reconnaissance on a domain: it starts with a manual trigger, lets you set a target domain (e.g., example.com), queries Google Public DNS to retrieve all DNS records, filters only A/AAAA records to extract IP addresses, pauses 10 seconds per IP to respect Shodan rate limits, queries the Shodan API for each IP to gather open ports, services, technologies, vulnerabilities, organization, and location data, robustly parses the results (handling errors, empty responses, and diagnostics), then appends every finding as a structured row to a Google Sheet while also logging to the console for quick review. The purpose is fast, reliable internet-facing asset discovery and enrichment. You‚Äôll see one row per service/port with timestamp, IP, port, service, tech stack, HTTP info, CVEs, org, location, and more. To use it: (1) update the domain in Set Target Domain, (2) add your Shodan API key in the HTTP node, (3) set your Google Sheet ID in the Sheets node, then click ‚ÄúTest workflow‚Äù. Expect detailed, append-only logging ‚Äî perfect for security recon or asset inventory.**

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
